mooTree 2

Note that there's a packed version of the script ("mootree_packed.js") which is smaller, and therefore more suitable for deployment on production sites - while developing and debugging, you will probably want to use plain "mootree.js", which is used in these examples.

  • Basic example: adding items manually via JavaScript, finding nodes
  • Adopting example: demonstrating the adopt() method
  • Dynamic example: dynamically adding/removing tree nodes
  • Event example: demonstrating node- and tree-level events
  • XML example: demonstrates loading of tree structures from XML files (requires a webserver)
